Directions: Read the following information, then answer each question that follows.
Content: In `1929`, the astronomer Edwin Hubble published the data shown. The graph plots the velocity of galaxies relative to Earth against the distances of galaxies from Earth.

Hubble's data can be modeled by the equation `v=500d`, where `v` is the velocity, in `text(kilometers per second)`, at which the galaxy is moving away from Earth and `d` is the distance, in `text(megaparsecs)`, of the galaxy from Earth. Assume that the relationship is valid for larger distances than are shown in the graph. (A `text(megaparsec)` (`text(Mpc)`) is `3.1xx10^19` `text(kilometers)`.)
